lines.text: Madam, just because I drive a truck does not make me a truck driver.

[talking to himself, while driving down the motorway]
With full devout courage, of sundry folk, by adventure fall, in fellowship, and pilgrims were they all.
[waves to a passing car]
Good morning, pilgrims! Morning!

[offering a treat to his dog Boswell]
Hors d'ouevre, Boswell?

[over that radio, as Quid is getting ready to go to bed]
Base 4 to Gypsy 397, are you there?

[responding sacrastically]
Mayday, mayday, this is flight 77, I seem to be in a great deal of trouble, I'm losing fuel, I need help!
Is that you Gypsy 397?
Negative darling. This is Quid, Patrick Anthony Quid. As in British sterling.
Why do we always have trouble with you Gypsy 397?
Because you keep calling me "Gypsy 397".

[to his dog]
Might be able to pick this one up and take her to Perth with me? Dazzling her with my stylish rhetoric and witty inuendos, eh?
He's just killed a girl.
Did he make love to her first?
I don't know. What's the difference?
It makes a lot of difference. I think in order to play the game properly we have to know what he thinks of women.
What the hell!
Aren't you kind of young to be hitchhiking out here all by yourself?
Aren't you kind of old to be picking me up?
No, it's Q-U-I-D. 'D' as in death to young girls, you cretin!
I know you're looking for a little adventure.
I could go to Disneyland for a little adventure. What I'm looking for is a little excitement.
It's my game.
Okay, Sherlock
